word_means: 悬旗于（flag 的现在分词）

means: 悬旗于（flag 的现在分词）
悬旗于（flag 的现在分词）

example: the flagging in the garden was quite imaginative
there was a pile of flagging waiting to be laid in place

example.ex: The Marines climbed to the roof of the embassy building to raise the American flag...
example.tran: 海军陆战队队员爬到使馆大楼顶上，升起了美国国旗。

example.ex: They had raised the white flag in surrender.
example.tran: 他们已经举起白旗投降。

value.def: A flag is a piece of cloth which can be attached to a pole and which is used as a sign, signal, or symbol of something, especially of a particular country.
A flag is a small piece of paper or cloth attached to a stick or pin which is sold on a flag day or used to mark a particular spot.
value.tran: (在售旗募捐日出售或在某个位置上作标记用的)小旗，旗状物

example.ex: Joining John Whitaker will be his brother Michael also riding under the British flag...
example.tran: 约翰·惠特克将与他的兄弟迈克尔一起代表英国参加这场自行车赛。

example.ex: The airport was opened by Canadian troops operating under the flag of the United Nations.
example.tran: 机场由加拿大军队以联合国的名义开放。

gramarinfo.label: with supp, usu adj N, N <l>of</l> n

value.def: Journalists sometimes refer to the flag of a particular country or organization as a way of referring to the country or organization itself and its values or power.
value.tran: 旗帜(新闻用语，代指某个国家、组织或其价值观、权力)

example.ex: His enthusiasm was in no way flagging...
By 4,000m he was beginning to flag.
example.tran: 跑到4,000米时，他开始体力不支。

value.def: If you flag or if your spirits flag, you begin to lose enthusiasm or energy.
A flag is the same as a flagstone .

example.ex: Steve Crabb can fly the flag with distinction for Britain in Barcelona.
example.tran: 史蒂夫·克拉布在巴塞罗那可以旗帜鲜明地支持英国。

value.def: If you fly the flag, you show that you are proud of your country, or that you support a particular cause, especially when you are in a foreign country or when few other people do.
value.tran: (在国外时)表示并号召拥护自己的国家;（为少数人支持的事业)摇旗呐喊

example.ex: Marlette was already out of the door, flagging down a taxi.
example.tran: 马利特已经出门了，正挥手招呼一辆出租车。

value.def: If you flag down a vehicle, especially a taxi, you wave at it as a signal for the driver to stop.
value.tran: 挥手拦下，招手叫(尤指出租车)

example.ex: Staff can use the noticeboard to flag up any concerns.
example.tran: 员工可以用布告栏表达任何关注。

example.ex: I think there are more important issues and I just wanted to flag that up.
example.tran: 我想还有更重要的问题，我只是希望能引起对它的重视。

mean.def: If you flag up something such as a problem, you bring it to someone's attention.
